class gamedata.G_Baccarat(matchID, date, amountWon=0, amountLost=0)¶

Bases: gamedata.MatchData, gamedata.GameData

Baccarat- played against dealer 2-9 cards are value ace is 1, rest=0, add hand take ones place number as score 0-9

class gamedata.G_Roulette(matchID, date, amountWon=0, amountLost=0)¶

Bases: gamedata.MatchData, gamedata.GameData

Roulette- 1 to 10 and 19 to 28, odd numbers are red and even are black. In ranges from 11 to 18 and 29 to 36, odd numbers are black and even are red

class gamedata.GameData(gameID)¶

Bases: object

pull_data_from_DB()¶

Pull data from GameMain

update_data_to_DB(new_playerWon, new_playerLost)¶

Find the difference between class amount won and lost VS stored amount won and lost in the DB then update the amounts appropriately to the MatchData, PlayerFinance, and GameMain tables GID is the first 3 digits of MID

class gamedata.MatchData(matchID, date, amountWon=0, amountLost=0)¶

Bases: object

pull_data_from_DB()¶

Retrive amount won, amount lost, and date in MatchData table by matching self.ID with MID

update_data_to_DB(new_amountWon, new_amountLost, new_date)¶

Find the difference between class amount won and lost VS stored amount won and lost in the DB then update the amounts appropriately to the MatchData, PlayerFinance, and GameMain tables GID is the first 3 digits of MID
